description: In 2020, 60 Minutes checked in on the groundbreaking 90+ study and its members, a group of Americans age 90 and above still thriving in old age. Lesley Stahl revisited the participants, whom she first met in 2014, and caught up with the scientists expanding their findings on what leads to a longer, healthier life, with a special focus on memory and dementia.
title: What scientists have learned from studying people over 90 | 60 Minutes Archive

description: Officials identified her on Thursday as JoAnne "Vicki" Smith, who was only 20 years old when she died.
title: Illinois cold case finally solved nearly 50 years later

description: Clean your clothing faster and more efficiently with a new on-sale washer and dryer this 4th of July.
title: The best 4th of July washer and dryer deals

description: The lawsuit against the NFL covered 2.4 million residential subscribers and 48,000 businesses who paid for the "Sunday Ticket" package of out-of-market games.
title: NFL hit with nearly $4.8 billion in damages in "Sunday Ticket" antitrust case

description: Millions of Americans are preparing to get out of town for the holiday weekend. That will likely mean busy roads, packed airports and train stations.
title: Are you traveling for July Fourth? Here's how to beat the travel rush.

description: Discover the best deals on top-rated dishwashers for your kitchen this Fourth of July.
title: Best 4th of July 2024 deals on dishwashers

description: Dania Furniture recalls Hayden bookcase sold nationwide after an unanchored unit fell over, killing a 4-year-old.
title: Bookcase recalled after child dies in tip-over incident

description: Researchers say ultra-processed foods that are high in fats, starches, sugars and additives now make up 73% of the U.S. food supply, even though they are linked to health issues like diabetes, obesity, cancer and depression. Scientists say these foods should be regulated with tobacco-style warnings and advertising bans. Trish Cotter, global lead for the Food Policy Program at Vital Strategies, joined CBS News to discuss ultra-processed foods.
title: Scientists calling for warnings, ad bans on ultra-processed foods

description: President Biden and former President Donald Trump will meet up Thursday night for their first 2024 debate without a live audience and, theoretically, without the ability to talk over each other. With that new format in mind, CBS News' Errol Barnett takes a trip through the history of televised presidential debates.
title: The history of modern presidential debates

description: Three major mobile carriers say customers abroad can't make phone calls, send messages.
title: AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon confirm service outages for customers abroad

description: A week out from the 4th of July holiday, a record number of Americans appear to already be hitting the roads and skies. FAA Administrator Michael Whitaker told "CBS Mornings" that Thursday will be the busiest travel day in the U.S. in 15 years. CBS News correspondent Meg Oliver is at Newark Liberty International Airport with a report from the travel trenches.
title: Why more Americans are traveling earlier for holidays

description: Chewy's stock price surged as high as $39.10, or 36%, after meme stock investor Keith Gill posted a dog image on social media.
title: Roaring Kitty posts image of a dog, and Chewy's stock price jumps

description: House Majority Whip Tom Emmer, a Republican from Minnesota, told CBS News that former President Donald Trump would tout achievements from his administration when he matches up with President Biden in Thursday night's presidential debate. Emmer also spoke about the unique format of the debate and the role abortion will play in it.
title: Rep. Tom Emmer on Biden and Trump's first 2024 debate

description: Republican State Superintendent Ryan Walters said every classroom in Oklahoma will have a Bible.
title: Oklahoma superintendent requires public schools to teach the Bible

description: Thursday's apparent coup attempt in Bolivia came to a head after President Luis Arce confronted the rebel military general leading the rebellion and ordered him to stand down. The armored vehicles and troops that had marched to the presidential palace then retreated, with the general and other senior officers later arrested. Angus McNelly, senior lecturer in international relations at the University of Greenwich and author of "Now We Are in Power: The Politics of Passive Revolution in 21st Century Bolivia," joined CBS News to discuss what happened.
title: Bolivian president confronted rebel military general during apparent coup attempt

description: "CBS Mornings" co-host Nate Burleson gets emotional during a speech ahead of his son's college journey.
title: Nate Burleson celebrates son's college sendoff

description: "CBS Mornings" co-anchor Nate Burleson is marking a special milestone: his son, Nehemiah, heading off to college. The 18-year-old is attending the University of Nevada, where he committed to play on the school's football team alongside his older brother Nathaniel II.
title: "CBS Mornings" co-host Nate Burleson celebrates son's college journey

description: Owners of an Arizona wound care company allegedly targeted elderly patients, many of them terminally ill, in sprawling medical scheme, the Justice Department said.
title: Wound care company charged for billing older patients about $1M each in skin graft scheme

description: Four in 10 companies admitted to posting fake job listings. Here are the reasons why.
title: That job you applied for might be a fake. Here's why.

description: Proposed rule would make it easier to switch to another service provider for the phone you already own.
title: FCC wants carriers to unlock phones within 60 days of activation

description: Police confirm small plane crash by McKinney National Airport; Multiple train cars derailed in Matteson, Illinois, causing a  mandatory evacuation order.
title: 6/27: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: Credit card debt forgiveness can have a negative impact on your credit. But how long might that impact last?
title: How long does credit card debt forgiveness stay on your credit report?

description: You'll need an Amazon Prime membership to get Prime Day deals, but is an Amazon Prime membership worth the cost?
title: How much is Amazon Prime? Is the membership worth it?

description: Thursday night's debate between President Biden and former President Donald Trump comes on the heels of new data released by the White House that shows border crossings are down more than 40% in the three weeks since the president's immigration executive order. CBS News national security contributor Samantha Vinograd has more on how both candidates might approach the topic of immigration in the debate.
title: Immigration's place in the Biden-Trump debate

description: Bronny James has been picked by the Los Angeles Lakers in the second round of the NBA draft.
title: LeBron James' son Bronny selected by Lakers in NBA draft

description: President Biden and former President Trump's Thursday night debate comes just hours after the Supreme Court's ruling to allow abortions in Idaho if a woman's health is in danger. CBS News campaign reporter Shawna Mizelle has more on how big a role abortion will play in the debate.
title: How abortion will play into first Biden-Trump debate of 2024

description: Officials in Matteson, Illinois, are urging residents within a mile of a freight train derailment to evacuate, with a post on the town's Facebook page saying they should plan for a "long-term evacuation." Police say the train derailed Thursday morning and crews are checking each freight car for potential chemical leaks. CBS News Chicago's Suzanne Le Mignot is on the scene with more.
title: Freight train derails outside Chicago, evacuations underway

description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar, a Democrat from Minnesota, says democracy is on the ballot in this year's election. She spoke with CBS News ahead of Thursday's first Biden-Trump debate of 2024. See the interview for Klobuchar's thoughts on abortion rights, Donald Trump's actions after the 2020 election and President Biden's age.
title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar on Biden's debate with Trump and abortion rights

description: Both President Biden and former President Trump are vying for the Latino vote, which analysts believe could play a decisive role in the 2024 race, especially in Nevada. CBS News campaign reporter Nidia Cavazos spoke to some Latino voters about their thoughts on the race for the White House.
title: Latino voters discuss most important issues to them ahead of Biden-Trump debate

description: If you want to add gold to your portfolio, a digital investment in gold stocks or ETFs could make sense right now.
title: 5 big reasons to invest in gold stocks and ETFs this July

description: A judge on Thursday set a June 2025 start date for the trial of Bryan Kohberger, the suspect accused of murdering four Idaho college students in 2022.
title: Judge sets June 2025 trial date for suspect in Idaho college murders

description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says there has been an extremely high rate of heat-related emergency room visits as scorching temperatures grip the U.S. this summer. Emergency medicine physician Dr. Owais Durrani joined CBS News to discuss how to stay safe in hot weather.
title: Extreme heat leads to more emergency room visits

description: High-yield savings accounts are offering impressive returns now. Here are 10 of the best to consider for July.
title: 10 best high-yield savings accounts for July 2024

description: Evacuations are underway after a freight train derailed in Matteson, Illinois on Thursday morning, as crews work to determine if hazardous materials have leaked from the train.
title: Evacuations underway after freight train derails in Matteson, Illinois

description: Vermont has agreed to pay $175,000 to settle a lawsuit on behalf of a man who was charged with a crime for giving a state trooper the middle finger in 2018.
title: Man arrested after flipping off Vermont trooper to get part of $175K settlement

description: Allies of President Biden and former President Donald Trump set expectations for historic matchup.
title: Atlanta takes the stage in first presidential debate

description: Recall involves about 132,000 units due to lithium-ion batteries that can overheat, with $20,000 in property damage reported.
title: Baseus power banks recalled after dozens of fires, 13 burn injuries

description: Are you considering opening a CD account this July? Then you'll want to avoid making these three critical mistakes.
title: 3 critical CD account mistakes to avoid this July

description: The close-up look at the Boeing facility aimed to show changes the company said are being made after a door panel blew out mid-flight earlier this year.
title: Rare glimpse into Boeing 737 Max production facility amid turmoil

description: The Bay Area plants racked up more than 100 violations for allegedly releasing toxic emissions into the atmosphere over the last five years.
title: Tesla Bay Area plant ordered to stop spewing toxic emissions

description: Major Supreme Court decisions on Trump immunity and Jan. 6 still pending; Supreme Court ruling allows abortions in Idaho in rare cases to protect a woman's health.
title: 06/27: CBS News 24/7 Episode 1

description: Our appliance experts have curated this roundup of the best washers for 2024.
title: The 6 best washing machines for 2024

description: Okinawa's mayor says a U.S. soldier's alleged sexual assault not only "causes great fear to local residents," but "tramples on the dignity of women."
title: U.S. soldier charged with sexually assaulting a teenage girl in Japan

description: If you've defaulted on your credit card debt, here's what you can expect to happen to it over time.
title: What happens to unpaid credit card debt after 7 years?

description: Drone footage shows the large hole, which is estimated to be at least 30 feet deep and 100 feet wide.
title: Massive sinkhole swallows Illinois soccer field after mine collapses

description: A U.N. mission of foreign law enforcement led by Kenya is arriving in Haiti to try to curb the ongoing surge in gang violence there. Once all personnel arrive, there will be 2,500 police and soldiers from multiple countries including the Bahamas, Bangladesh and Jamaica. Eyder Peralta, an international correspondent for NPR, joined CBS News to discuss the situation in Haiti.
title: Foreign police led by Kenyan forces in Haiti to curb gang violence

description: Here's what CDK Global had to say about restoring its systems after company was hacked.
title: CDK updates dealers on status of sales software restoration after cyberattack

description: As Boeing faces multiple whistleblower complaints over safety, the company gave a tightly controlled media tour aimed at showing the changes it says are being made in real time after a door panel blew out of an Alaska Airlines flight in January.
title: Glimpse inside Boeing manufacturing plant amid turmoil

description: Discover the best smart home hubs from Amazon and Google and learn how they can help you in your home.
title: The 6 best smart home hubs for 2024

description: The original 1997 illustration for the front of the first Harry Potter book has set a record for Potter-themed memorabilia on the auction block.
title: Harry Potter cover art fetches a record price at auction in New York

description: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson issued a separate opinion in the Supreme Court's ruling to allow emergency abortions in Idaho, for now. Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman and Stephen Wermiel, professor of practice at American University Washington College of Law, shed some details on why Justice Jackson concurred with the majority opinion, but still had misgivings.
title: Inside Justice Jackson's separate opinion in Idaho abortion ruling

description: Walmart and Target are launching their own sales to go up against Amazon's Prime Day on July 16 and 17. Business Insider senior retail reporter Alexander Bitter joined CBS News to discuss the deals.
title: Amazon, Walmart and Target announce massive July sales

description: President Biden's campaign team released a statement following the Supreme Court's decision to allow abortions in Idaho in rare cases where a woman's life is in danger. The statement says in part, "Women's health, lives and freedoms remain in peril across the country because of Donald Trump... If Trump returns to the White House, he and his allies will ban abortion in all 50 states." CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden campaign responds to Supreme Court's Idaho abortion ruling

description: A new study found no association between multivitamins and lower risk of death. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Céline Gounder shares what you need to know.
title: Daily multivitamins do not help you live longer, study finds

description: 2024 Paris Olympics organizers say air conditioning isn't needed as athlete accommodation has "eco-focused cooling solutions." Team USA isn't convinced.
title: Team USA is bringing its own air conditioning to the Paris Olympics

description: Save big on these top-rated robot mops ahead of Amazon Prime Day 2024.
title: The best robot mops deals to shop ahead of Prime Day 2024

description: The Supreme Court ruled that abortions can be performed in Idaho in rare, emergency cases to protect a woman's health. Former federal prosecutor Scott Fredericksen, University of Texas at Austin professor of law Elizabeth Sepper, CBS News campaign reporters Shawna Mizelle and Katrina Kaufman joined CBS News to break down the decision.
title: What to know about the Supreme Court's Idaho abortion ruling

description: As you shop and compare lenders, be ready to negotiate for lower interest rates and closing costs to save money.
title: How much can you save by shopping for a home equity loan?

description: Police said a 20-year-old man flew from New Jersey to Florida to attack another gamer with a hammer after a dispute through the video game "ArcheAge."
title: Man flies to Florida to attack gamer with hammer after online dispute, police say

description: CDs can offer meaningful returns. But how much should you deposit? Here's what experts say.
title: What's the minimum you should deposit in a CD? Here's what experts say

description: Walmart is going head to head with Amazon Prime Day in a competition that shoppers will ultimately win.
title: What to know about Walmart's rival Amazon Prime Day sale, 'Walmart Deals'

description: Taco Bell's move comes as more Americans complain about how much fast-food prices have increased in recent years.
title: Taco Bell launches $7 Luxe Cravings Box promo. Here's what's inside.

description: President Biden still holds a large lead over former President Donald Trump with Black voters in the latest CBS News poll, but the support is lagging behind where it was in 2020. Trump has in turn deployed several high-profile Black surrogates in an effort to garner more support. CBS News campaign reporter Taurean Small has more.
title: Trump looking to close gap with Black voters

description: Conditions in Gaza are continuing to deteriorate with aid groups saying at least 35 children have died from famine in the enclave. Meanwhile, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says a phase of the IDF's operation in the southern Gaza city of Rafah could soon end with troops possibly being redeployed to Israel's border with Lebanon where strikes have been exchanged with Hezbollah. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has more.
title: Children starving to death in Gaza, Netanyahu says part of Rafah operation could soon end

description: Some scientists say a fossil of a Neanderthal child with apparent Down syndrome suggests the species were compassionate caregivers.
title: Fossil of Neanderthal child with Down syndrome fuels debate over species

description: The Supreme Court on Thursday ruled that abortions can be performed in Idaho in certain medical emergencies to protect a woman's health, reinstating a lower court's order that blocked the state from enforcing a near-total ban on abortion. Norah O'Donnell anchored CBS News' special report on the ruling.
title: Supreme Court allows emergency abortions in Idaho for now | Special Report

description: President Biden and former President Donald Trump will go head-to-head Thursday night in a debate that CBS News polls show won't make a difference to most voters who plan to watch. CBS News political correspondent Caitlin Huey-Burns has a preview of the matchup.
title: 67% of voters planning to watch Biden-Trump debate say it won't change their views

description: "We can serve payers very effectively from the footprint that remains," CEO Tim Wentworth says of the coming closures.
title: Walgreens to close up to a quarter of its roughly 8,600 U.S. stores

description: Despite early setbacks including a shelved debut album, RAYE'S determination and talent have led her on a journey from obscurity to stardom.
title: RAYE reflects on her career highs and lows

description: In two rulings released Thursday, the Supreme Court has blocked both the EPA good neighbor rule meant to fight air pollution and Purdue Pharma's bankruptcy plan that would've broadly protected the Sackler family from civil lawsuits related to their role in the opioid epidemic. Former federal prosecutor Scott Fredericksen joined CBS News to discuss the decisions.
title: Supreme Court blocks EPA's "good neighbor" rule, Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan

description: The Supreme Court ruled 6-3 along ideological lines that defendants facing civil penalties for securities fraud are entitled to a jury trial.
title: Supreme Court strips SEC of key enforcement power to penalize fraud

description: The dispute pitted Idaho's near-total abortion ban against a federal law that requires Medicare-funded hospitals to offer abortions when needed to stabilize a patient's emergency medical condition.
title: Supreme Court says emergency abortions can be performed in Idaho

description: It can be more difficult to secure this type of coverage as you age, but experts say these strategies could help.
title: Buying long-term care coverage in your 70s? 3 tips for getting approved

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals,  Gayle Bass shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Singer-songwriter RAYE won an historic six trophies at the BRIT Awards earlier this year. But it didn't come without hardships. She discusses her sobriety, faith and breakthrough moment with "CBS Mornings."
title: Singer-songwriter RAYE reflects on the highs and lows through her music career

description: The Supreme Court on Thursday derailed a multi-billion-dollar bankruptcy plan for Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin, siding with the Biden administration.
title: Supreme Court rejects Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan

description: See Simone Biles, Suni Lee, Jordan Chiles and more at the U.S. Olympic Gymnastics Team Trials today.
title: How to watch the U.S. Olympic Gymnastics Team Trials tonight

description: A giant sinkhole, estimated to be around 100 feet wide, opened up in the middle of a soccer field in Alton, Illinois, on Wednesday. Nobody was on the field at the time and no one was hurt, according to the local mayor.
title: Huge sinkhole opens up in middle of soccer field in Illinois

description: An outside review gave 19 recommendations for the USTA to improve its system for protecting minor athletes from sexual misconduct and other abuses.
title: U.S. Tennis Association can do more to protect players, review says

description: The Supreme Court ruled 5-4 to grant the request from Ohio, two other states and energy companies.
title: Supreme Court blocks EPA rule aimed at combating air pollution

description: Where exactly are cases of dengue fever being detected? What to know after U.S. health officials warned doctors​ to be alert for the mosquito-borne virus.
title: Maps show dengue fever risk areas as CDC warns of global case surge

description: Scientists calculated the devastating impacts of the months-long 2023 Canadian wildfires.
title: Canadian wildfires released more gases than burning fossil fuels: Study

description: A draft opinion of a highly anticipated ruling from the Supreme Court involving abortion accidentally showed up online Wednesday. It appears likely the court will side with the Biden administration to allow emergency abortions in Idaho amid the state's strict law.
title: Supreme Court appears likely to allow emergency abortions in Idaho

description: The CDC is warning that dengue fever is surging around the world and the risk of the mosquito-borne disease spreading in the U.S. is on the rise. Dr. Céline Gounder, editor-at-large for public health at KFF and CBS News medical contributor, has more on the illness.
title: Dengue fever detected across new regions, CDC warns its on the rise around the world

description: A new study found taking multivitamins every day does not help you live longer. Researchers studied the medical records of nearly 400,000 healthy Americans over 20 years. CBS News medical contributor Dr. Celine Gounder explains the groundbreaking study.
title: Taking daily multivitamins doesn't help you live longer, new research shows

description: Iranians will elect a new president after their last was killed in a plane crash. Here's why many say they won't even bother to vote.
title: Why Iran's presidential election is failing to inspire hope for change

description: The Federal Aviation Administration predicts nearly 54,000 flights will take off Thursday as travel ramps up ahead of the Fourth of July holiday. FAA Administrator Michael Whitaker discusses safety amid the busy travel season as TSA prepares to screen more than 32 million people over the next week and a half.
title: FAA administrator talks safety during busy travel season

description: Voters in Iran will elect their next president Friday after President Ebrahim Raisi was killed in a helicopter crash last month. As CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer reports, many Iranians don't appear motivated to vote, as whoever wins is unlikely to deliver any real change.
title: Iranians to pick new president in an election drawing minimal interest

description: President Biden and former President Donald Trump will take the stage tonight to face off in the first presidential debate ahead of the November election. It is the first time the two are sharing a stage since the events of Jan. 6. One in five voters tell CBS News this debate will help them decide who to vote for.
title: Biden, Trump face off in presidential debate rematch

description: Catastrophic flooding that hit the Midwest includes millions of acres of vital farmland in the nation's corn belt, leading to concerns that food prices could be impacted. Many farmers told CBS News they have crop insurance, but it doesn't even cover their losses for things like irrigation, fertilizer and labor.
title: Historic flooding in Midwest damages farms, leading to concerns over food prices impact

description: The idea of "Horizon" has been nearly 30 years in the making for Costner. He first commissioned the story in 1988, even before "Dances with Wolves."
title: Inside Kevin Costner's nearly 30-year journey to bring "Horizon" to life

description: Kenyans furious over proposed tax hikes and the deadly police response to earlier protests take to the streets again - under much tighter security.
title: Kenya protests resume as leader's tax hike concession fails to quell anger

description: The first presidential debate between former President Donald Trump and President Joe Biden is on Thursday night. Also, a big decision may have leaked from the Supreme Court, with major implications for abortion rights. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: First presidential debate between Biden and Trump is tonight

description: "Horizon: An American Saga" director and star Kevin Costner tells "CBS Mornings" co-anchor Gayle King about his decision to quit "Yellowstone" after five seasons of playing the iconic raspy-voiced Montana rancher John Dutton.
title: Kevin Costner explains "Yellowstone" departure

description: Kevin Costner returned to the director's chair with his most ambitious project yet. The Oscar-winning actor-director writes, directs, produces and stars in "Horizon: An American Saga," a four-part movie series about the American West. Costner talks to "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King about the years-long effort to make "Horizon" and his future plans after leaving "Yellowstone."
title: Kevin Costner on bringing "Horizon" to life and what's next after "Yellowstone" departure

description: For the first time, reporters were invited to the U.S. military's floating pier off the coast of Gaza. CBS News' Imtiaz Tyab was among those to get a rare glimpse at the operation, which has struggled to deliver aid to Palestinians.
title: Rare look at U.S. military pier that has struggled to deliver aid to Gaza

description: The NTSB said a Boeing executive disclosed non-public information from an investigation into the January incident.
title: Boeing sanctioned by NTSB for releasing details of Alaska Airlines probe

description: Harold Becker and John Goltz decided to move into Becker's parents' Tampa home to care for them.
title: A gay couple care for aging parents, decades after coming out to them

description: Oklahoma plans to execute Richard Rojem, who was convicted of kidnapping, raping and killing a 7-year-old girl — his ex-stepdaughter — in 1984.
title: Oklahoma set to execute man for kidnap, rape, murder of ex-stepdaughter, 7

description: The countdown is on for the first head-to-head debate of 2024 between President Biden and former President Donald Trump.
title: How to watch the first presidential debate between Biden and Trump

description: Climate change is thinning snow and ice on Mount Everest, exposing the bodies of hundreds of mountaineers who died chasing their dreams.
title: Mount Everest's melting ice reveals bodies in the "death zone"

description: Having trouble sleeping, but a sleep divorce feels too drastic? Here's what to know about the Scandinavian sleep method and if it's right for you.
title: Benefits of the Scandinavian sleep method, explained by a sleep expert

description: The DNC will be referencing Trump's attempts to change the election results in Georgia, in details first shared with CBS News.
title: Biden campaign, DNC highlight democracy, Jan. 6 in lead-up to debate

description: Supreme Court "inadvertently" uploads copy of Idaho abortion opinion; Grandmother hits the road to seek out bone marrow donors
title: 6/26: CBS Evening News

description: There are about 30 million children across the country living in homes with guns, according to the CDC.
title: Gun violence prompts doctors to ask patients about home firearm safety

description: Jeana Moore just walked 334 miles from Spokane, Washington, to Seattle, as her form of gratitude for the bone marrow transplant that saved her granddaughter's life. Now she does it to enroll even more donors.
title: Grandmother hits the road to seek out bone marrow donors

description: The American Academy of Pediatrics urges doctors to discuss firearm safety with parents, but it's a touchy subject that has medical professionals learning more about how to have those conversations. Nikki Battiste has more.
title: How doctors are trying to change the conversation around safe gun storage

description: China is outpacing the U.S. by at least a decade in developing nuclear power, according to a new report by the nonprofit Information Technology and Innovation Foundation. Hank Jenkins-Smith, public policy professor at the University of Oklahoma, joins CBS News to examine why the U.S. is falling behind.
title: China outpacing U.S. in nuclear power development, report finds

description: A nasty controversy is brewing in Olympic waters with one month until the Paris opening ceremony. Les Carpenter, Olympics reporter for The Washington Post, joins CBS News to explain why the city's iconic Seine River is still falling short of the requirements needed before athletes dive in.
title: Seine river remains highly contaminated ahead of Paris Olympics

description: Kenya's president says he will not sign a controversial finance bill into law. The reversal comes a day after dozens of people were killed and injured in clashes with police while protesting the measure, which included hefty tax hikes. BBC Africa correspondent Barbara Plett Usher has the latest.
title: Kenya's president drops support for tax hikes after deadly protests

description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange returned to his native Australia as a free man on Wednesday. In a deal brokered by the Justice Department, Assange pleaded guilty to a single felony charge for publishing U.S. military secrets. CBS News foreign correspondent Ramy Inocencio is in the Australian capital of Canberra with more.
title: Julian Assange lands in Australia a free man after plea deal

description: American Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich appeared in court with his head newly shaved as his trial began in Russia on Wednesday. The 32-year-old faces 20 years in prison for allegedly spying on a facility linked to the Russian military on behalf of the CIA, but Russian officials have not provided any evidence to support those claims. CBS News correpondent Lilia Luciano reports.
title: What to know about Evan Gershkovich's Russian trial

description: White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan met Wednesday with Israel's defense minister to discuss the war with Hamas. The meeting comes as a U.N.-backed report finds scores of Palestinians in Gaza face a risk of famine in the coming months. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has more from Tel Aviv.
title: U.N.-backed report says 500,000 Gazans face famine risk

description: President Biden is offering pardons to military veterans who were convicted of a crime based on their sexual orientation. Wednesday's move is expected to affect thousands of former service members who were convicted under a former military law that criminalized consensual gay sex. CBS News chief investigative correspondent Jim Axelrod has more.
title: Biden pardons veterans convicted under military gay sex ban

description: Extreme flooding caused a more-than-100-year-old dam to partially fail this week in Minnesota, and officials say the structure is in "imminent failure condition." CBS News' Tom Hanson is at the dam with the latest.
title: Minnesota dam partially fails after extreme flooding

description: Migrant crossings at the southern border are down about 40% since early June, according to the Department of Homeland Security. The Biden administration attributes the drop to the president's executive action restricting asylum claims. CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez has the details.
title: Illegal border crossings down 40% since asylum crackdown, Homeland Security says

description: The Supreme Court says a document was "inadvertently" uploaded to its site Wednesday after Bloomberg reported the opinion on a highly anticipated abortion case was briefly posted online. The case centers on Idaho's near-total abortion ban versus a federal measure requiring hospitals to perform emergency abortions. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson breaks it down.
title: How Idaho abortion case could play out after accidental Supreme Court post

description: "I've been doing this as an officer for 23 years now and I have never seen anything like this ... It's very disturbing," said Chris Powell of Arlington police.
title: One murder charge, but at least 19 other clients of Arlington businesswoman dead: "It's very disturbing"

description: President Biden says he is righting a "historic wrong" by offering pardons to thousands of veterans who were convicted of crimes under a former military law that banned same-sex relationships. Jim Axelrod has the story.
title: Biden pardons convicted LGBTQ+ service members
